item.description: ०१ मूलम् - Weber उद᳘रमेॗवास्य स᳘दः॥ त᳘स्मात्स᳘दसि भक्षयन्ति यॗद्धीदं किं᳘ चाश्न᳘न्त्युद᳘र एॗवेदᳫं स᳘र्वम् प्र᳘तितिष्ठत्य᳘थ य᳘दस्मिन्वि᳘श्वे देवा अ᳘सीदंस्त᳘स्मात्स᳘दो ना᳘म त᳘ उ एॗवास्मिन्नेते᳘ ब्राह्मणा᳘ विश्व᳘गोत्राः सीदन्त्यैन्द्रं᳘ देव᳘तया॥ Eggeling The Sadas 1 is no other than his (Vishṇu, the sacrifice’s) belly; therefore they feed (drink) in the Sadas; for whatever food is eaten here on earth, all that settles down in the belly. And because all the gods sat (sad) in it, therefore it is called sadas: and so do these Brāhmans of every family now sit therein.

०१ मूलम् - Weber विजा᳘मानो हैॗवास्य धि᳘ष्ण्याः॥ इमे᳘ समङ्का ये वै᳘ समङ्कास्ते᳘ विजा᳘मान एत᳘ उ हैॗवास्यैत᳘ आत्म᳘नः 1 ॥ Eggeling The Dhishṇya-hearths 2, forsooth, are no other than its (the sacrifice’s) congeners 3. They have the same marks, and those which have the same marks are congeners; and these, then, are those (corresponding limbs) of its trunk. ०२ मूलम् - Weber दिवि वै सो᳘म आ᳘सीत॥ अ᳘थेह᳘ देवास्ते᳘ देवा᳘ अकामयन्ता᳘ नः सोमो गछेत्तेना᳘गतेन यजेमही᳘ति त᳘ एते᳘ माये᳘ असृजन्त सुपर्णीं च कद्रूं᳘ च वा᳘गेव᳘ सुपॗर्णीयं᳘ कद्रूस्ता᳘भ्याᳫं सम᳘दं चक्रुः॥

०१ मूलम् - Weber स᳘र्वं वा᳘ एॗषो ऽभि᳘ दीक्षते॥ यो दी᳘क्षते यज्ञᳫं ह्य᳘भि दी᳘क्षते यॗज्ञᳫं ह्येॗवेदᳫं स᳘र्वम᳘नु तं᳘ यज्ञ᳘ᳫं᳘ सम्भृ᳘त्य य᳘मिम᳘मभि दी᳘क्षते स᳘र्वमिदं विसृजते॥ Eggeling Verily he who consecrates himself, consecrates himself for the sake of this All; for he consecrates himself for the sacrifice, and this All indeed results from 1 the sacrifice; having prepared the sacrifice for which he consecrates himself, he now sets free (or produces) this All.

०१ मूलम् - Weber यू᳘पं व्रक्ष्य᳘न्वैष्णव्य᳘र्चा᳘ जुहोति॥ विष्णवो हि यू᳘पस्त᳘स्माद्वैष्णव्य᳘र्चा᳘ जुहोति॥ Eggeling Being about to cut the sacrificial stake, he offers 1 with a verse addressed to Vishṇu. For the stake belongs to Vishṇu; therefore he offers with a verse addressed to Vishṇu. ०२ मूलम् - Weber य᳘द्वेव᳘ वैष्णव्या᳘ जुहो᳘ति॥ यज्ञो वै वि᳘ष्णुर्यज्ञे᳘नैॗवैतद्यू᳘पम᳘छैति त᳘स्माद्वैष्ण᳘व्य᳘र्चा᳘ जुहोति॥ Eggeling And again, why he offers with a verse addressed to Vishṇu–Vishṇu being the sacrifice, he thus approaches the stake by means of the sacrifice: therefore he offers with a verse addressed to Vishṇu.
